bug.short_desc: The IE 8 does not work after a minor qooxdoo update

long_desc.thetext:
We have made a minor qooxdoo update from SHA 19efa703981897cbce97451b1426f0fcc7086a2f to SHA fe3025bf8e35a3704854feb0de1eacbf6daed983. After we have done this update, our application does not anymore work in IE 8.
The error message is: Executing code failedTypeError: Das Objekt unterst√ºtzt diese Eigenschaft oder Methode nicht.
The problem seems to be that the polyfill for the array method "indexOf" does not anymore work. There was a bugfix (bug 6665) between the two qooxdoo versions which refactored the polyfill for "indexOf".

May be this issue could be fixed by adding a "#require()" hint from the class that uses the environment key "ecmascript.array.indexof" to the class that sets the environment key "ecmascript.array.indexof".
Otherwise our javascript dependency analysator will think that the class "qx.bom.client.EcmaScript" is never needed and therefore will not send this class to the browser.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 6737 ***
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
